comment.author: 89161852@N06
comment._content:
Not a Hunter.  This is the sole Hawker P1081, VX279.  
It took the front fuselage and wings of the swept wing P1052 and replaced the rear fuselage with a straight through jetpipe, rather than the split one similar to that used by the Sea Hawk, and swept tail surfaces,  It first flew 19 June 1950, and was destroyed in a fatal flying accident 3 April 1951.
